page.syntax: Result_Flag as L = UnZip(C zipfilename[,C files[,C path[,c unzip_flags]]])

argument.name: zipfilename
argument.description: The name of the zip file. It is necessary to explicitly specify the .ZIP extension.

argument.name: files
argument.description: A pattern that selects files from the zip file. Wildcards are allowed.

argument.name: path
argument.description: The target directory for the unzipped files.

argument.name: unzip_flags
argument.description: Optional. P = Creates the same subfolder structure under Destination_Folder that the original files had.

page.description: Extract files from a zip file - use optional name/path.
page.discussion: The FILE.UNZIP() method extracts the files that match the mask from Zip_Filename, and places the files in the Output_Directory. If the files are successfully extracted, Result_Flag will be .T. . If the zip file was created with path information stored in the zip file, then the mask must include the path that is stored in the zip file. For example, using the FILE.ZIPLIST() method, you can see the internal name for all files in the zip file.

section.example: ? file.ziplist("c:\backup.zip", "n" + crlf()) data/backup/Mesurements.Dbf data/backup/Mesurements.Cdx data/backup/Mesurements.Ddd data/backup/Mesurements.Ddm data/backup/Mesurements.Ddx
